response:
The combination of Optic Neuritis and a Medullary syndrome involving the Area Postrema (intractable cough) in a young patient is the hallmark presentation of Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD). Multiple Sclerosis is the second most likely cause of multifocal demyelination. MOGAD and inflammatory/infiltrative conditions like Neurosarcoidosis are important differentials.

differential_diagnosis = ["Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "Multiple Sclerosis", "MOG Antibody Disease (MOGAD)", "Neurosarcoidosis", "Neuro-Behcet's Disease", "Brainstem Glioma"]
